thread.title: Two rare elephants found dead in Indonesia: official
thread.title_full: Two rare elephants found dead in Indonesia: official

title: Two rare elephants found dead in Indonesia: official
text:
Two rare elephants found dead in Indonesia: official October 15, 2015 Elephants are increasingly being killed on Indonesia's Sumatra island, usually by villagers who regard the beasts as pests or poachers for their tusks 
Two critically endangered Sumatran elephants have been found dead from suspected poisoning in Indonesia's Aceh province, an official said Thursday. 
Villagers found the carcasses of the female elephants, aged two and 15, bleeding from their mouths and rectums in the forest near Panggong village in Aceh Jaya district on Wednesday, local conservation agency chief Genman Suhefti Hasibuan told AFP. 
"Based on our preliminary findings, we suspect they were poisoned but we still need to conduct further tests to confirm," he said. 
There were no gunshot wounds or snare injuries on the elephants, which were found only 10 metres (33 feet) apart, he added. 
Protection group the International Union for Conservation of Nature classifies the Sumatran elephant as critically endangered, with an estimated 2,400 to 2,800 remaining in the wild. 
It is one of many species that are under threat in Indonesia, an archipelago with some of the world's largest remaining tropical forests. 
Conflicts between humans and animals are increasing as people encroach on their habitats. 
The elephants are usually either killed by villagers, who regard the beasts as pests that destroy their plantations, or by poachers for their tusks. Three endangered elephants found dead in Indonesia December 9, 2010 
Three endangered Sumatran elephants have been found dead after their herd rampaged through a village in western Indonesia, a conservationist and officials said Thursday. Rare elephant found dead in Indonesia May 16, 2012 
A critically-endangered Sumatran elephant has been found dead in Indonesia's Aceh province, an official said Wednesday, the second death from suspected poisoning within a month. 3 Sumatran elephants found poisoned in Indonesia June 1, 2012 
(AP)  An environmentalist says three endangered Sumatran elephants have been poisoned and found dead within a palm oil plantation in western Indonesia. Sumatra elephants probably poisoned for revenge, official says November 12, 2012 
Three critically-endangered Sumatran elephants found dead in Indonesia's Riau province were probably poisoned in a revenge attack by palm oil plantation workers, an official said Monday. Sumatran elephants found dead, poisoning suspected June 3, 2013 
Two critically endangered Sumatran elephants were found dead in an Indonesian national park and it is believed they were poisoned, the WWF environmental group said Monday. Two rare Indonesian elephants found dead without tusks September 8, 2014

Four biological kingdoms influence disease transmission in monarch butterflies October 13, 2015 
Experiments with monarch butterfly caterpillars and the milkweed plants on which they feed have shown for the first time that interactions across four biological kingdoms can influence disease transmission.
